header.title: Esoteric Extension of Tarot to Develop Supersensory Powers

central_thesis: The systematic study and application of Tarot symbols, particularly through the framework of the B.O.T.A. (Builders of the Adytum) teachings, is essential for developing supersensory powers, achieving conscious union with the Higher Self, and mastering one's environment. This development is achieved through a process of spiritual discipline, self-awareness, and the transmutation of personal limitations, with symbols serving as the language of the subconscious.

structure_content.chapter_title: Lesson 8: Transcriptions from Ann Davies' Class Lectures
structure_content.summary: This lesson, presented as transcriptions from Ann Davies' lectures, delves into the importance of understanding relationships, the dangers of making success an obsession, and the primary goal of achieving conscious union with the Higher Self. It emphasizes that material goals, when pursued through occult training, serve as stepping stones for spiritual development. The text distinguishes between mastering the environment through the personality versus through spiritual control, and warns against misinterpreting submission to the Divine Will as an excuse for inaction. It highlights the role of symbols, particularly the 22 Tarot Keys, in bypassing conscious resistance and influencing the subconscious, thereby facilitating spiritual growth and the development of supersensory abilities. The lectures also touch upon the importance of faith, the nature of self-love versus selfishness, and the universal laws of attraction and radiation.

key_concepts.definition: The ultimate spiritual consciousness or divine aspect within an individual, with which the primary goal is to achieve conscious and continuous union. It is equated with God, the Lord of the Universe.

Abilities that transcend ordinary physical senses, developed through the esoteric study and application of Tarot and occult principles, leading to a deeper understanding and mastery of self and environment.

The language of the subconscious, essential for occult work. They bypass conscious resistance and directly influence the subconscious mind, facilitating spiritual growth and the development of powers. Tarot Keys are presented as potent symbols that build faith and consciousness.

A disciplined process, exemplified by the B.O.T.A. work, involving step-by-step goals, testing, and consistent effort, aimed at developing spiritual muscles, control, and ultimately, union with the Higher Self.

The ability to control and influence one's surroundings, not through the personality's desire to dominate others, but through spiritual control, recognizing difficulties as tests for developing this ability.

A crucial element for occult development, distinct from mere intellectual assent. True faith involves trust in the Divine Will, which is cultivated through the subconscious influence of symbols like the Tarot Keys, and is the opposite of anxiety.

The ultimate state of being, achieved through spiritual development and the understanding that all life is interconnected and manifests the Divine. This is expressed through loving and unselfish acts.

practical_system.description: The core practical system involves the rigorous study and application of Tarot symbols as taught by the B.O.T.A. This is not merely intellectual study but a process of integrating these symbols into the subconscious through consistent practice, meditation, and deliberate application to material and spiritual goals. The aim is to develop 'spiritual muscles' and control by using material objectives as stepping stones towards conscious union with the Higher Self. Key practices include understanding symbols as the language of the subconscious, cultivating faith through this symbolic work, and reframing challenges as exercises in environmental control. The system emphasizes diligent work, conscious expectation, and the transmutation of personal limitations. A weekly practice is suggested: observing conduct towards close associates and consciously transforming discordant situations into harmonious ones through praise, affection, and concern.
tools: Tarot Deck (specifically the 22 Major Trumps are highlighted).
Symbols (as a means of communication with the subconscious).
rituals: Concentration on specific Tarot Keys (implied through 'hammering into you').
Daily study and work with Tarot symbols.
Goal setting for material things as stepping stones.
Cultivating 'unselfish acts' consciously, even with mixed motives, until they become spontaneous.
Observing interactions and consciously creating harmony through praise and affection.

relevant_quotes.text: If we base our happiness on being "at the top" in any aspect of life, we prepare for ourselves a special hell. The concentration of energy is misplaced in this area.
In occultism it is vital to keep always in mind that the primary goal is the achieving of conscious and continuous union with the Higher Self!
We must do this because this is what we are here to do. We are here to master our environment.
The second attitude is that of "he who conforms his will to My Will," but such conforming of one's will to the Divine Will does not mean that one becomes a jelly fish.
The primary goal for every human soul is to attain conscious and continuous union with the Higher Self.
The moment that we think that we know something absolutely, we lock the door tight.
The occult path has its sorrows as well as its joys, and those who avoid the sorrows must also avoid the joys; indeed, avoid everything.

One of the essentials in preparation for such work is to learn the importance and the use of symbols. We have to understand their importance, because subconsciousness uses the language of symbols; indeed, it is the only language subconsciousness has!
Symbols, the use of them, the understanding of them, the recognition of their power, is an absolute essential!
The first little demon that we have to contend with is lack of faith.
Words are powerful only when they create a symbol or image in your mind.
Because the subconscious habit pattern of reaction is so strong and has been feeding the conscious response for so long, consciously we react in terms of "I knew it wouldn't work."

This is the purpose of symbols, and this is why it is so important to apply yourself to the use and understanding of Tarot and Qabalah and the Tree of Life. This is what will help you to develop the true love nature.

You could not enjoy reading a book, if you had not gone through the disciplines of learning your ABCs, learning words, learning how to bring them together in sentences, and learning how to deal with abstract thought. In the same way, if you want the joy of attaining conscious and deliberate union with God, the kind that is usable, you must undergo discipline and training.

We do not trust our beloved ones to God. We have not faith that God will look after them. If we have no faith that God will look after them, certainly we have no faith that He will look after us, no matter how much we play-act.
Curiously enough, when you really fall in love with yourself in the spiritual sense, you do fall into an ocean and you do drown, but in a different way.
The people whom we think of as in love with themselves in a negative sense, who seem to be self-centered, ego manic, are not in love with themselves.
We all yearn for unity with God whether we know it or not. When we love one another, it is because we are expressing unity with God.
The truly unselfish act is one in which the doer does not know that he has performed it.

A happy center radiates happiness to everyone around. A person who loves radiates love to everyone around. A person who hates radiates hate to everyone around. That is the way in which the universal laws work.

critical_analysis.relevance: This text is highly relevant to practitioners of Western Esotericism, particularly those within the B.O.T.A. tradition, focusing on Tarot as a system for spiritual development and the cultivation of psychic abilities. It offers a philosophical underpinning and practical directives for integrating occult study into daily life, emphasizing self-mastery and union with the divine.
critical_analysis.target_audience: Advanced students of esoteric traditions, particularly those engaged with the Tarot as a spiritual tool, and individuals seeking to develop higher consciousness and supersensory perception through disciplined occult study. It assumes a pre-existing understanding of concepts like the Higher Self and occult principles.
